required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Entecavir to Adefovir in Chronic Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) Patients With Hepatic Decompensation
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Efficacy and Safety of Entecavir Versus Adefovir in Subjects Chronically Infected With Hepatitis B Virus and Evidence of Hepatic Decompensation

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase IIIb comparative study of entecavir 1.0 mg once daily (QD) vs. adefovir 10 mg QD in patients who have chronic hepatitis B infection and hepatic decompensation. The patients are treated for 96 weeks after the last subject is randomized.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) DNA by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Mean reduction in serum HBV DNA determined by PCR assay (log10 copies/mL) at Week 24 adjusted for baseline HBV DNA and lamivudine resistance (LVDr) status, based on linear regression analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HBV DNA by PCR at Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline in HBV DNA by PCR at Week 48, adjusted for baseline HBV DNA and LVDr Status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With HBV DNA < 300 Copies/mL by PCR At Week 24
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With HBV DNA < 300 Copies/mL by PCR At Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 48

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving Alanine Transaminase (ALT) Normalization (≤1.0 x Upper Limit of Normal [ULN]) at Weeks 24 and 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants in each group who achieved ALT normalization (≤1.0 x upper limit of normal [ULN]) among those with baseline ALT >1.0 x ULN at Weeks 24 and 48

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Achieving Composite Endpoint (HBV DNA < 10*4 Copies/mL by PCR Assay and Normal ALT [≤ 1.0 x ULN]) Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 48

secondary_outcome.measure: >=2-Point Reduction From Baseline in Child-Pugh Score Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Child-Pugh classification assesses the prognosis of chronic liver disease by 5 clinical measures, scored 1-3 each (most severe derangement=3). Score range: 5 (best prognosis) to 15 (worst prognosis).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Improvement or No Worsening in Child-Pugh Score From Baseline to Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants in each group with improvement or no worsening in Child-Pugh score from baseline to Week 48 as measured by improvement or no worsening in Child-Pugh score. Child-Pugh classification assesses the prognosis of chronic liver disease by 5 clinical measures, scored 1-3 each (most severe derangement=3). Score range: 5 (best prognosis) to 15 (worst prognosis).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Child-Pugh Score Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline in Child-Pugh score through week 48. Child-Pugh classification assesses the prognosis of chronic liver disease by 5 clinical measures, scored 1-3 each (most severe derangement=3). Score range: 5 (best prognosis) to 15 (worst prognosis).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Improvement in Child-Pugh Class at Week 24 and Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants in each group with improvement in Child-Pugh score from baseline to Week 48 as measured by improvement in Child-Pugh class. Improvement in Child-Pugh Class is defined as change from B to A or C to A. Evaluable subjects are subjects with Child-Pugh Class B or C at Baseline. Child-Pugh classification assesses the prognosis of chronic liver disease by 5 clinical measures, scored 1-3 each (most severe derangement=3). Score range: 5 (best prognosis) to 15 (worst prognosis). Child-Pugh class A to C employs the added score from above: 5-6=Class A; 7-9=Class B; 10-15=Class C.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) Scores From Baseline Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Adjusted mean change from baseline in MELD score through Week 48 (adjusted for baseline value). The Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD), is a scoring system for assessing the severity of chronic liver disease. MELD uses the patient's values for serum bilirubin, serum creatinine, and the international normalized ratio for prothrombin time (INR) to predict survival. In interpreting the MELD Score in hospitalized patients, the 3 month mortality is: 40 or more=100% mortality; 30-39=83% mortality; 20-29=76% mortality; 10-19=27% mortality; <10=4% mortality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement or No Worsening in MELD Score Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with improvement or no worsening (any decrease or no change from baseline in score) in MELD score through Week 48. The Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD), is a scoring system for assessing the severity of chronic liver disease. MELD uses the patient's values for serum bilirubin, serum creatinine, and the international normalized ratio for prothrombin time (INR) to predict survival. In interpreting the MELD Score in hospitalized patients, the 3 month mortality is: 40 or more=100% mortality; 30-39=83% mortality; 20-29=76% mortality; 10-19=27% mortality; <10=4% mortality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Changes From Baseline in Quality of Life as Measured by the Short Form 36 (SF-36)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 24, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Scoring for the SF-36 will be done using the algorithm developed by the Research ANd Development(RAND) Corporation (a scale of 0-100). Higher scores represent better quality of life. Coding for items with 2-category responses=0 and 100; 3-category=0/50/100; 5-category=0/25/50/75/100; 6-category=0/20/40/60/80/100. Scores of items in the same scale are combined to create the 8 scale scores (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily-pain, general health, vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, mental health). Physical and mental health composite scores will be computed for the group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Changes From Baseline in Quality of Life, as Measured by EuroQol-5D (EQ-5D) at Weeks 24 and 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 24, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D has 5 attributes (mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression), each with 3 levels (no problem, some problems, and major problems). This algorithm gives valuation (weights) to each of the 15 responses on the form. Each valuation is a negative number, subtracted from the maximum score of 1 (perfect well being). The overall health index score ranges from 0 (dead) to 1 (perfect health) value scale, and the visual analog scale ranges from 0 to 100. Item weights will be obtained from the EuroQol group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Albumin Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Mean albumin levels, and mean change from baseline in albumin, a measure of synthetic liver function. Normal range for albumin = 3.5 - 5.3 g/dL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Prothrombin Time Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Mean prothrombin time, and mean change from baseline in prothrombin time, a measure of synthetic liver function. Prothrombin time is the time it takes (in seconds) for a sample of blood to clot. Normal range for prothrombin time (PT) = 10-13 seconds.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Bilirubin Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Mean total bilirubin levels, and mean change from baseline in total bilirubin, a measure of liver secretory function.Normal range for total bilirubin = 0.2 - 1.2 mg/dL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Platelet Count Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Mean baseline platelet count and mean change from baseline in platelet count at specific timepoints. Platelets are the smallest particles found in the blood, which play a major role in forming blood clots. Normal range for platelets = 140 - 450 X 10*9 c/L.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants Achieving Albumin Normalization Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who achieved normalization of albumin (>= 1 x lower limit of normal [LLN]), a measure of liver function, at specific timepoints.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants Achieving Prothrombin Time Normalization Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who achieved normalization of prothrombin time (<= 1 x ULN), a measure of liver function, at specific timepoints.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants Achieving Total Bilirubin Normalization Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who achieved normalization of total bilirubin (<= 1 x ULN), a measure of liver function, at specific timepoints.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants Achieving Platelet Count Normalization Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who achieved normalization of platelet count (>= 1 x lower limit of normal [LLN]), a measure of liver function, at specific timepoints.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) Events at Different Time Points Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: HCC-free survival was analyzed using life tables. Measured values show the number of HCC events among treated participants at given time points.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Deaths, HCC, Discontinuations Due to AEs, and Confirmed Creatinine Increase >=0.5 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: on-treatment events obtained after the start of therapy and no more than 5 days after the last dose of study therapy.
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence/worsening of a pre-existing medical condition regardless of causal relationship. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence at any dose that: results in death; is life-threatening; requires/prolongs inpatient hospitalization; results in persistent/significant disability; is cancer; is congenital anomaly/birth defect; results in drug dependency/abuse; is an important medical event. Grades:1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe, 4=Life-threatening/disabling, 5=Death. Confirmed increase in serum creatinine=values ≥0.5 mg/dL compared with baseline on 2 sequential measures.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Grade 3/4 Laboratory Abnormalities - Week 48 and Cumulative Data
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 48=all on-treatment laboratory measurements up to Week 48. Cumulative data = on-treatment laboratory measurements obtained after the start of therapy and no more than 5 days after the last dose of study therapy.
secondary_outcome.description: Grade 3/4 laboratory abnormalities (hematology, electrolyte, lipase, liver function, metabolic, renal function, urinalysis). The Week 48 data set was used to evaluate the Week-48 on-treatment safety. The cumulative data set was used to evaluate the safety while on treatment. Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v3.0 (CTCAE) Grades:1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe, 4=Life-threatening/disabling, 5=Death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Flares - On Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On-treatment=up to Week 48 (Day 336); if discontinued early, all data up to 5 days after discontinuation date.
secondary_outcome.description: ALT flare=ALT > 2 x baseline and > 10 x upper limit of normal (ULN) by clinical laboratory evaluation. Table includes number of participants with selected clinical events and/or laboratory abnormalities during ALT flares. Selected clinical events during ALT flares=ascites, hepatic encephalopathy, jaundice, bacterial peritonitis. Selected Laboratory abnormalities during ALT flares=international normalized ratio > 1.5 or prothrombin time >= 1.2 x ULN and total bilirubin >2.5 mg/dL and > 1 mg/dL increase from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Malignant Neoplasms - On Treatment or During 24-Week Follow-up Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On-treatment=up to Week 48 (Day 336); if discontinued early, all data up to 5 days after discontinuation date. 24-week follow-up=limited to end-of-dosing values and those from 6 days after last dose of study therapy to end of follow-up.
secondary_outcome.description: Data includes type of malignant neoplasm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Undergoing Liver Transplant - On-Treatment or 24-Week Follow-Up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On-treatment=up to Week 48 (Day 336); if discontinued early, all data up to 5 days after discontinuation date. 24-week follow-up=limited to end-of-dosing values and those from 6 days after last dose of study therapy to end of follow-up.

intervention.description: Tablets, Oral, 1 mg once daily, 96 weeks from the time the last patient is randomized
Tablets, Oral, 10 mg, once daily, 96 weeks from the time the last patient is randomized

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion
- Child-Pugh (CP) score >= 7
- Hepatitis B virus (HBV) viremia
Exclusion
- Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) > 15 x upper limit of normal (ULN)
- Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)/hepatitis C virus (HCV)/hepatitis D virus (HDV) coinfection

facility.name: University Of Miami School Of Medicine

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 431 participants were enrolled into the study. 236 were never randomized (213 no longer met study criteria; 6 withdrew consent; 3 died; 1 for administrative reasons by sponsor; 1 for adverse events; 1 lost to follow-up; 11 for other reasons).

participants_list.participants: As-randomized population was used in efficacy analyses, unless otherwise noted.
As-randomized population was used in efficacy analyses, unless otherwise noted.
2 subjects randomized to ADV were treated with ETV for the entire dosing period and included in ETV.
2 subjects randomized to ADV were treated with ETV for the entire dosing period and included in ETV.
2 subjects randomized to ADV were treated with ETV for the entire dosing period and included in ETV.
2 subjects randomized to ADV were treated with ETV for the entire dosing period and included in ETV.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Subject No Longer Meets Study Criteria

measure.title: Age
Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
measure.description: Other category includes Asian Indian, South African "color," "mixed ancestry," and "mixed race"

measure.title: Region of Enrollment
Child-Pugh Class
measure.description: The Child-Pugh classification is used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease. The score employs 5 clinical measures of liver disease; each measure is scored 1-3, with 3 indicating most severe derangement. Total possible score is 15. Chronic liver disease is classified into Child-Pugh class A to C, employing the added score from above: 5-6=Class A; 7-9=Class B; 10-15=Class C. As-Randomized population.

measure.title: Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT)
measure.description: As-randomized population

measure.title: Child-Pugh Score
measure.description: The Child-Pugh classification is used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease. The score employs 5 clinical measures of liver disease; each measure is scored 1-3, with 3 indicating most severe derangement. Total possible score is 15. Chronic liver disease is classified into Child-Pugh class A to C, employing the added score from above: 5-6=Class A; 7-9=Class B; 10-15=Class C. As-Randomized population.

measure.title: HBV DNA by PCR
measure.description: HBV=hepatitis B virus, PCR=polymerase chain reaction. As-Randomized population.

measure.title: Mayo End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) score
measure.description: The Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD), is a scoring system for assessing the severity of chronic liver disease. MELD uses the patient's values for serum bilirubin, serum creatinine, and the international normalized ratio for prothrombin time (INR) to predict survival. In interpreting the MELD Score in hospitalized patients, the 3 month mortality is: 40 or more=100% mortality; 30-39=83% mortality; 20-29=76% mortality; 10-19=27% mortality; <10=4% mortality. As-randomized population.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) DNA by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) at Week 24
outcome.description: Mean reduction in serum HBV DNA determined by PCR assay (log10 copies/mL) at Week 24 adjusted for baseline HBV DNA and lamivudine resistance (LVDr) status, based on linear regression analysis.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 24
outcome.population: Treated Subjects - As-Randomized, modified intention-to-treat (ITT) efficacy data set. Includes on-treatment data (obtained after the start of therapy and no more than 5 days after the last dose of study therapy) collected for treated subjects. Includes those participants with PCR measurements in the Week 24 analysis window.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) DNA by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) at Week 24
measure.description: Mean reduction in serum HBV DNA determined by PCR assay (log10 copies/mL) at Week 24 adjusted for baseline HBV DNA and lamivudine resistance (LVDr) status, based on linear regression analysis.
measure.population: Treated Subjects - As-Randomized, modified intention-to-treat (ITT) efficacy data set. Includes on-treatment data (obtained after the start of therapy and no more than 5 days after the last dose of study therapy) collected for treated subjects. Includes those participants with PCR measurements in the Week 24 analysis window.

analysis.method_desc: Linear regression model adjusted for baseline HBV DNA and LVDr status.

Includes those participants with PCR measurements in the Week 48 analysis window.

Improvement in Child-Pugh Class is defined as change from B to A or C to A. Evaluable subjects are subjects with Child-Pugh Class B or C at Baseline. Child-Pugh classification assesses the prognosis of chronic liver disease by 5 clinical measures, scored 1-3 each (most severe derangement=3). Score range: 5 (best prognosis) to 15 (worst prognosis). Child-Pugh class A to C employs the added score from above: 5-6=Class A; 7-9=Class B; 10-15=Class C.

Improvement in Child-Pugh Class is defined as change from B to A or C to A. Evaluable subjects are subjects with Child-Pugh Class B or C at Baseline. Child-Pugh classification assesses the prognosis of chronic liver disease by 5 clinical measures, scored 1-3 each (most severe derangement=3). Score range: 5 (best prognosis) to 15 (worst prognosis). Child-Pugh class A to C employs the added score from above: 5-6=Class A; 7-9=Class B; 10-15=Class C.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) Scores From Baseline Through Week 48
outcome.description: Adjusted mean change from baseline in MELD score through Week 48 (adjusted for baseline value). The Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD), is a scoring system for assessing the severity of chronic liver disease. MELD uses the patient's values for serum bilirubin, serum creatinine, and the international normalized ratio for prothrombin time (INR) to predict survival. In interpreting the MELD Score in hospitalized patients, the 3 month mortality is: 40 or more=100% mortality; 30-39=83% mortality; 20-29=76% mortality; 10-19=27% mortality; <10=4% mortality.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
outcome.population: Treated participants - as-randomized populations; n=number of participants with assessment at baseline and timepoint. The modified intention-to-treat (ITT) efficacy data set included on-treatment data collected for treated subjects. On-treatment data are obtained after the start of therapy and <=5 days after the last dose of study therapy.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) Scores From Baseline Through Week 48
measure.description: Adjusted mean change from baseline in MELD score through Week 48 (adjusted for baseline value). The Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD), is a scoring system for assessing the severity of chronic liver disease. MELD uses the patient's values for serum bilirubin, serum creatinine, and the international normalized ratio for prothrombin time (INR) to predict survival. In interpreting the MELD Score in hospitalized patients, the 3 month mortality is: 40 or more=100% mortality; 30-39=83% mortality; 20-29=76% mortality; 10-19=27% mortality; <10=4% mortality.
measure.population: Treated participants - as-randomized populations; n=number of participants with assessment at baseline and timepoint. The modified intention-to-treat (ITT) efficacy data set included on-treatment data collected for treated subjects. On-treatment data are obtained after the start of therapy and <=5 days after the last dose of study therapy.

analysis.groups_desc: Covariate adjusted model for MELD score at Week 24
analysis.method_desc: Model estimate incorporates prognostic factors measured at baseline. Adjusted for baseline

analysis.groups_desc: Covariate adjusted model for MELD score at Week 48
analysis.method_desc: Model estimate incorporates prognostic factors measured at baseline. Adjusted for baseline

outcome.title: Improvement or No Worsening in MELD Score Through Week 48
outcome.description: Participants with improvement or no worsening (any decrease or no change from baseline in score) in MELD score through Week 48. The Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD), is a scoring system for assessing the severity of chronic liver disease. MELD uses the patient's values for serum bilirubin, serum creatinine, and the international normalized ratio for prothrombin time (INR) to predict survival. In interpreting the MELD Score in hospitalized patients, the 3 month mortality is: 40 or more=100% mortality; 30-39=83% mortality; 20-29=76% mortality; 10-19=27% mortality; <10=4% mortality.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 48
outcome.population: Treated Subjects - As-Randomized, modified intention-to-treat (ITT) efficacy data set (includes on-treatment data collected for treated subjects. On-treatment data are those obtained after the start of therapy and no more than 5 days after the last dose of study therapy.) n=number of participants with measurement at baseline and timepoint.

measure.title: Improvement or No Worsening in MELD Score Through Week 48
measure.description: Participants with improvement or no worsening (any decrease or no change from baseline in score) in MELD score through Week 48. The Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD), is a scoring system for assessing the severity of chronic liver disease. MELD uses the patient's values for serum bilirubin, serum creatinine, and the international normalized ratio for prothrombin time (INR) to predict survival. In interpreting the MELD Score in hospitalized patients, the 3 month mortality is: 40 or more=100% mortality; 30-39=83% mortality; 20-29=76% mortality; 10-19=27% mortality; <10=4% mortality.
measure.population: Treated Subjects - As-Randomized, modified intention-to-treat (ITT) efficacy data set (includes on-treatment data collected for treated subjects. On-treatment data are those obtained after the start of therapy and no more than 5 days after the last dose of study therapy.) n=number of participants with measurement at baseline and timepoint.

outcome.title: Mean Changes From Baseline in Quality of Life as Measured by the Short Form 36 (SF-36)
outcome.description: Scoring for the SF-36 will be done using the algorithm developed by the Research ANd Development(RAND) Corporation (a scale of 0-100). Higher scores represent better quality of life. Coding for items with 2-category responses=0 and 100; 3-category=0/50/100; 5-category=0/25/50/75/100; 6-category=0/20/40/60/80/100. Scores of items in the same scale are combined to create the 8 scale scores (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily-pain, general health, vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, mental health). Physical and mental health composite scores will be computed for the group.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 24, Week 48
outcome.population: This endpoint was not analyzed due to lack of complete data at 48 Weeks, but will be assessed at future time points.

measure.title: Mean Changes From Baseline in Quality of Life as Measured by the Short Form 36 (SF-36)
measure.description: Scoring for the SF-36 will be done using the algorithm developed by the Research ANd Development(RAND) Corporation (a scale of 0-100). Higher scores represent better quality of life. Coding for items with 2-category responses=0 and 100; 3-category=0/50/100; 5-category=0/25/50/75/100; 6-category=0/20/40/60/80/100. Scores of items in the same scale are combined to create the 8 scale scores (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily-pain, general health, vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, mental health). Physical and mental health composite scores will be computed for the group.
measure.population: This endpoint was not analyzed due to lack of complete data at 48 Weeks, but will be assessed at future time points.

outcome.title: Mean Changes From Baseline in Quality of Life, as Measured by EuroQol-5D (EQ-5D) at Weeks 24 and 48
outcome.description: The EQ-5D has 5 attributes (mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression), each with 3 levels (no problem, some problems, and major problems). This algorithm gives valuation (weights) to each of the 15 responses on the form. Each valuation is a negative number, subtracted from the maximum score of 1 (perfect well being). The overall health index score ranges from 0 (dead) to 1 (perfect health) value scale, and the visual analog scale ranges from 0 to 100. Item weights will be obtained from the EuroQol group.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 24, Week 48
outcome.population: This endpoint was not analyzed due to lack of complete data at 48 Weeks, but will be assessed at future time points.

measure.title: Mean Changes From Baseline in Quality of Life, as Measured by EuroQol-5D (EQ-5D) at Weeks 24 and 48
measure.description: The EQ-5D has 5 attributes (mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression), each with 3 levels (no problem, some problems, and major problems). This algorithm gives valuation (weights) to each of the 15 responses on the form. Each valuation is a negative number, subtracted from the maximum score of 1 (perfect well being). The overall health index score ranges from 0 (dead) to 1 (perfect health) value scale, and the visual analog scale ranges from 0 to 100. Item weights will be obtained from the EuroQol group.
measure.population: This endpoint was not analyzed due to lack of complete data at 48 Weeks, but will be assessed at future time points.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Albumin Through Week 48
outcome.description: Mean albumin levels, and mean change from baseline in albumin, a measure of synthetic liver function. Normal range for albumin = 3.5 - 5.3 g/dL.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
outcome.population: Treated participants - as randomized; n=number of participants with value at baseline and given timepoint.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Albumin Through Week 48
measure.description: Mean albumin levels, and mean change from baseline in albumin, a measure of synthetic liver function. Normal range for albumin = 3.5 - 5.3 g/dL.
measure.population: Treated participants - as randomized; n=number of participants with value at baseline and given timepoint.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Prothrombin Time Through Week 48
outcome.description: Mean prothrombin time, and mean change from baseline in prothrombin time, a measure of synthetic liver function. Prothrombin time is the time it takes (in seconds) for a sample of blood to clot. Normal range for prothrombin time (PT) = 10-13 seconds.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
outcome.population: Treated, as-randomized. Subjects with normal values at baseline were excluded from the analysis. n=number of participants with value at baseline and given timepoint.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Prothrombin Time Through Week 48
measure.description: Mean prothrombin time, and mean change from baseline in prothrombin time, a measure of synthetic liver function. Prothrombin time is the time it takes (in seconds) for a sample of blood to clot. Normal range for prothrombin time (PT) = 10-13 seconds.
measure.population: Treated, as-randomized. Subjects with normal values at baseline were excluded from the analysis. n=number of participants with value at baseline and given timepoint.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Bilirubin Through Week 48
outcome.description: Mean total bilirubin levels, and mean change from baseline in total bilirubin, a measure of liver secretory function.Normal range for total bilirubin = 0.2 - 1.2 mg/dL.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
outcome.population: Treated, as-randomized. Subjects with normal values at baseline were excluded from the analysis. n=number of participants with value at baseline and given timepoint.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Bilirubin Through Week 48
measure.description: Mean total bilirubin levels, and mean change from baseline in total bilirubin, a measure of liver secretory function.Normal range for total bilirubin = 0.2 - 1.2 mg/dL.
measure.population: Treated, as-randomized. Subjects with normal values at baseline were excluded from the analysis. n=number of participants with value at baseline and given timepoint.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Platelet Count Through Week 48
outcome.description: Mean baseline platelet count and mean change from baseline in platelet count at specific timepoints. Platelets are the smallest particles found in the blood, which play a major role in forming blood clots. Normal range for platelets = 140 - 450 X 10*9 c/L.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
outcome.population: Treated, as-randomized. Subjects with normal values at baseline were excluded from the analysis. n=number of participants with value at baseline and given timepoint.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Platelet Count Through Week 48
measure.description: Mean baseline platelet count and mean change from baseline in platelet count at specific timepoints. Platelets are the smallest particles found in the blood, which play a major role in forming blood clots. Normal range for platelets = 140 - 450 X 10*9 c/L.
measure.population: Treated, as-randomized. Subjects with normal values at baseline were excluded from the analysis. n=number of participants with value at baseline and given timepoint.

outcome.title: Participants Achieving Albumin Normalization Through Week 48
outcome.description: Number of participants who achieved normalization of albumin (>= 1 x lower limit of normal [LLN]), a measure of liver function, at specific timepoints.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
outcome.population: Treated subjects (as randomized). Excludes subjects with normal albumin at Baseline. Non-completer = failure.

measure.title: Participants Achieving Albumin Normalization Through Week 48
measure.description: Number of participants who achieved normalization of albumin (>= 1 x lower limit of normal [LLN]), a measure of liver function, at specific timepoints.
measure.population: Treated subjects (as randomized). Excludes subjects with normal albumin at Baseline. Non-completer = failure.

outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48
outcome.population: Treated subjects - as-randomized. Excludes participants with normal prothrombin time at baseline. Non-completer = failure.

outcome.title: Number of Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) Events at Different Time Points Through Week 48
outcome.description: HCC-free survival was analyzed using life tables. Measured values show the number of HCC events among treated participants at given time points.
outcome.time_frame: Week 48
outcome.population: Treated, through Week 48 - (analyzed as-treated). (Week 48 on-treatment safety data contain all on-treatment data up to study Day 336, if the subject is still on treatment. If the subject discontinued before study Day 336, then all data up to 5 days after the discontinuation date were included.) n=number of participants at risk at each timepoint.

measure.title: Number of Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) Events at Different Time Points Through Week 48
measure.description: HCC-free survival was analyzed using life tables. Measured values show the number of HCC events among treated participants at given time points.
measure.population: Treated, through Week 48 - (analyzed as-treated). (Week 48 on-treatment safety data contain all on-treatment data up to study Day 336, if the subject is still on treatment. If the subject discontinued before study Day 336, then all data up to 5 days after the discontinuation date were included.) n=number of participants at risk at each timepoint.

analysis.groups_desc: treatment comparison of HCC-free survival at Week 48
analysis.method_desc: Cox proportional hazard model, adjusted for age <=45 versus age >45 years, gender, and race (white versus non-white).

outcome.title: Cumulative Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Deaths, HCC, Discontinuations Due to AEs, and Confirmed Creatinine Increase >=0.5 mg/dL
outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence/worsening of a pre-existing medical condition regardless of causal relationship. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence at any dose that: results in death; is life-threatening; requires/prolongs inpatient hospitalization; results in persistent/significant disability; is cancer; is congenital anomaly/birth defect; results in drug dependency/abuse; is an important medical event. Grades:1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe, 4=Life-threatening/disabling, 5=Death. Confirmed increase in serum creatinine=values ≥0.5 mg/dL compared with baseline on 2 sequential measures.
outcome.time_frame: on-treatment events obtained after the start of therapy and no more than 5 days after the last dose of study therapy.
outcome.population: As-treated population (all randomized subjects treated with at least 1 dose of study therapy, ETV or ADV, based on actual treatment received). Note that 5 additional enrolled participants died prior to initiation of treatment and are not included in this table.

measure.title: Cumulative Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Deaths, HCC, Discontinuations Due to AEs, and Confirmed Creatinine Increase >=0.5 mg/dL
measure.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence/worsening of a pre-existing medical condition regardless of causal relationship. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence at any dose that: results in death; is life-threatening; requires/prolongs inpatient hospitalization; results in persistent/significant disability; is cancer; is congenital anomaly/birth defect; results in drug dependency/abuse; is an important medical event. Grades:1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe, 4=Life-threatening/disabling, 5=Death. Confirmed increase in serum creatinine=values ≥0.5 mg/dL compared with baseline on 2 sequential measures.
measure.population: As-treated population (all randomized subjects treated with at least 1 dose of study therapy, ETV or ADV, based on actual treatment received). Note that 5 additional enrolled participants died prior to initiation of treatment and are not included in this table.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Grade 3/4 Laboratory Abnormalities - Week 48 and Cumulative Data
outcome.description: Grade 3/4 laboratory abnormalities (hematology, electrolyte, lipase, liver function, metabolic, renal function, urinalysis). The Week 48 data set was used to evaluate the Week-48 on-treatment safety. The cumulative data set was used to evaluate the safety while on treatment. Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v3.0 (CTCAE) Grades:1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe, 4=Life-threatening/disabling, 5=Death.
outcome.time_frame: Week 48=all on-treatment laboratory measurements up to Week 48. Cumulative data = on-treatment laboratory measurements obtained after the start of therapy and no more than 5 days after the last dose of study therapy.
outcome.population: As-treated population (all randomized subjects treated with at least 1 dose of study therapy, ETV or ADV, based on actual treatment received).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Grade 3/4 Laboratory Abnormalities - Week 48 and Cumulative Data
measure.description: Grade 3/4 laboratory abnormalities (hematology, electrolyte, lipase, liver function, metabolic, renal function, urinalysis). The Week 48 data set was used to evaluate the Week-48 on-treatment safety. The cumulative data set was used to evaluate the safety while on treatment. Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v3.0 (CTCAE) Grades:1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe, 4=Life-threatening/disabling, 5=Death.
measure.population: As-treated population (all randomized subjects treated with at least 1 dose of study therapy, ETV or ADV, based on actual treatment received).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Flares - On Treatment
outcome.description: ALT flare=ALT > 2 x baseline and > 10 x upper limit of normal (ULN) by clinical laboratory evaluation. Table includes number of participants with selected clinical events and/or laboratory abnormalities during ALT flares. Selected clinical events during ALT flares=ascites, hepatic encephalopathy, jaundice, bacterial peritonitis. Selected Laboratory abnormalities during ALT flares=international normalized ratio > 1.5 or prothrombin time >= 1.2 x ULN and total bilirubin >2.5 mg/dL and > 1 mg/dL increase from baseline.
outcome.time_frame: On-treatment=up to Week 48 (Day 336); if discontinued early, all data up to 5 days after discontinuation date.
outcome.population: Treated participants - as treated. The on-treatment safety data set contains data from all randomized subjects treated with at least 1 dose of study therapy, ETV or ADV. Treatment group for safety data set is based on actual treatment received.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Flares - On Treatment
measure.description: ALT flare=ALT > 2 x baseline and > 10 x upper limit of normal (ULN) by clinical laboratory evaluation. Table includes number of participants with selected clinical events and/or laboratory abnormalities during ALT flares. Selected clinical events during ALT flares=ascites, hepatic encephalopathy, jaundice, bacterial peritonitis. Selected Laboratory abnormalities during ALT flares=international normalized ratio > 1.5 or prothrombin time >= 1.2 x ULN and total bilirubin >2.5 mg/dL and > 1 mg/dL increase from baseline.
measure.population: Treated participants - as treated. The on-treatment safety data set contains data from all randomized subjects treated with at least 1 dose of study therapy, ETV or ADV. Treatment group for safety data set is based on actual treatment received.

class.title: ALT flares, no clinical events/lab abnormalities
ALT flares, with clinical events/lab abnormalities

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Malignant Neoplasms - On Treatment or During 24-Week Follow-up Period
outcome.description: Data includes type of malignant neoplasm.
outcome.time_frame: On-treatment=up to Week 48 (Day 336); if discontinued early, all data up to 5 days after discontinuation date. 24-week follow-up=limited to end-of-dosing values and those from 6 days after last dose of study therapy to end of follow-up.
outcome.population: The on-treatment safety data set contains data from all randomized subjects treated with at least 1 dose of study therapy, ETV or ADV. Treatment group for safety data set is based on actual treatment received.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Malignant Neoplasms - On Treatment or During 24-Week Follow-up Period
measure.description: Data includes type of malignant neoplasm.
measure.population: The on-treatment safety data set contains data from all randomized subjects treated with at least 1 dose of study therapy, ETV or ADV. Treatment group for safety data set is based on actual treatment received.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Undergoing Liver Transplant - On-Treatment or 24-Week Follow-Up
outcome.time_frame: On-treatment=up to Week 48 (Day 336); if discontinued early, all data up to 5 days after discontinuation date. 24-week follow-up=limited to end-of-dosing values and those from 6 days after last dose of study therapy to end of follow-up.
outcome.population: The on-treatment safety data set contains data from all randomized subjects treated with at least 1 dose of study therapy, ETV or ADV. Treatment group for safety data set is based on actual treatment received.

measure.title: Number of Participants Undergoing Liver Transplant - On-Treatment or 24-Week Follow-Up
measure.population: The on-treatment safety data set contains data from all randomized subjects treated with at least 1 dose of study therapy, ETV or ADV. Treatment group for safety data set is based on actual treatment received.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
